name: Module 1: The Building Blocks - Crafting Clear and Correct Sentences
promptModifier: Hi there! Let's start with the absolute basics. This first module is all about building strong sentence foundations. We'll work on identifying and fixing common errors like fragments and run-on sentences. Our goal is to make sure every sentence you write is a complete, grammatically correct thought. We'll practice with lots of simple, fun exercises!

name: Module 2: Adding Variety - Using Different Sentence Structures
promptModifier: Ready to make your writing more engaging? This module focuses on sentence variety. We'll learn how to use simple, compound, and complex sentences to create a nice rhythm. I'll show you how to combine short, choppy sentences into longer, more sophisticated ones using conjunctions and clauses. It's like learning new LEGO shapes to build cooler things!

name: Module 3: The Mighty Paragraph - Topic Sentences and Supporting Details
promptModifier: Let's zoom in on the paragraph, the heart of any essay. We'll learn the 'hamburger model': a strong topic sentence (top bun), juicy supporting details (the patty), and a concluding sentence (bottom bun). The key takeaway will be how to ensure all your sentences in a paragraph support one single, clear idea.

name: Module 4: Making it Flow - Transitions and Cohesion
promptModifier: Ever feel like your ideas are disconnected? This module is about creating 'flow'. We'll explore transition words and phrases (like 'however', 'in addition', 'for example') that act as signposts for your reader, guiding them smoothly from one idea to the next. Your writing will become much more logical and easy to follow.

name: Module 5: The Pre-Writing Stage - Brainstorming and Outlining
promptModifier: Good writing starts before you even write a sentence! This session is all about planning. We'll practice different brainstorming techniques like mind mapping and freewriting to generate ideas. Then, we'll learn how to organize those ideas into a logical outline. A solid outline is the blueprint for a great essay.

name: Module 6: The Persuasive Essay - Crafting a Strong Thesis Statement
promptModifier: Now let's tackle a common essay type: the persuasive essay. The most important part is the thesis statement – your main argument boiled down to one sentence. We'll learn what makes a thesis strong, clear, and debatable. We'll practice writing and refining thesis statements on various topics.

name: Module 7: The Persuasive Essay - Body Paragraphs and Evidence
promptModifier: Building on our thesis, this module teaches how to construct convincing body paragraphs. Each paragraph should present a point, provide specific evidence (facts, examples, statistics), and explain how the evidence supports your thesis. We'll focus on the P.E.E. (Point, Evidence, Explanation) structure.

name: Module 8: The Persuasive Essay - Powerful Introductions and Conclusions
promptModifier: First and last impressions count! We'll learn techniques for writing engaging introductions that 'hook' the reader (e.g., with a question, a surprising fact, or an anecdote). We'll also practice writing strong conclusions that summarize the argument and leave a lasting impact, without just repeating everything.

name: Module 9: The Narrative Essay - Telling a Compelling Story
promptModifier: Time for some storytelling! This module focuses on narrative writing. We'll learn how to structure a story with a clear beginning, middle, and end. The key focus will be on 'showing, not telling' – using vivid descriptions and sensory details to bring your story to life for the reader.

name: Module 10: The Expository Essay - Explaining and Informing
promptModifier: In this module, we'll work on expository (or explanatory) writing. The goal is to present information clearly and logically. We'll explore different organizational patterns, like cause-and-effect and comparison-and-contrast, and practice writing to inform the reader on a topic in an unbiased way.

name: Module 11: Word Choice and Tone - Finding Your Voice
promptModifier: Let's talk about style! This session is about choosing the right words (diction) to create a specific tone (e.g., formal, informal, serious, humorous). We'll learn to avoid clichés and use stronger verbs and more precise nouns. This is where you start to develop your unique writing voice.

name: Module 12: The Art of Revision - Seeing Your Work with Fresh Eyes
promptModifier: Writing is rewriting! This module teaches you the crucial difference between revising (big-picture changes) and editing (small-picture corrections). I'll share strategies for re-reading your own work critically, focusing on things like clarity, organization, and strength of argument. We'll practice on a sample essay.

name: Module 13: The Final Polish - Editing and Proofreading
promptModifier: It's time for the final polish. In this session, we become detectives, hunting for errors in grammar, punctuation, spelling, and typing. I'll give you a checklist and teach you tricks like reading your work aloud or backwards to catch mistakes you might otherwise miss. This ensures your final draft is clean and professional.

name: Module 14: Academic Writing - Citing Sources and Avoiding Plagiarism
promptModifier: This is a very important module for students. We'll discuss why citing sources is essential in academic writing. I'll provide a simple introduction to common citation styles (like MLA or APA) and show you how to properly integrate quotes and paraphrases into your text. The goal is to use research ethically and effectively.

name: Module 15: Writing Under Pressure - Timed Essays and Exam Strategies
promptModifier: Feeling stressed about timed essays? This module gives you a game plan. We'll learn how to quickly analyze a prompt, create a mini-outline, manage your time effectively, and write a concise, focused essay within a time limit. These strategies will build your confidence for any exam.

name: Module 16: Writing Workshop - Peer Review and Final Project
promptModifier: In our final module, we bring it all together! We'll conduct a mini writing workshop where we practice giving and receiving constructive feedback. You'll work on a final writing piece, applying all the skills we've learned. I'll be here to guide you every step of the way. I can't wait to see what you create!
